N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2810.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

As used in these rules and regulations: (a) Commissioner shall mean the Commissioner
of the Division of Housing and Community Renewal. (b) Division shall mean the New York State

Division of Housing and Community Renewal (DHCR). (c) Housing preservation and community
renewal activities or rural preservation activities shall include: (1)
the new construction or the acquisition, maintenance, preservation, repair, rehabilitation or other improvement of
vacant or occupied housing accommodations; demolition or sealing of vacant
structures where necessary or appropriate; disposition of housing
accommodations; and management of housing accommodations as agent for the
owners, receivers, administrators or municipalities; (2)
activities, similar to those specified in
paragraph (a) of this subdivision, aimed at accomplishing similar purposes and
meeting similar needs with respect to retail and service establishments within
a region when carried out in connection with and incidental to a program of
housing related activities. (d) Immediate family shall mean, with
reference to an individual person, that person's parents, stepparents, spouse, brothers, stepbrothers, sisters, stepsisters, sons, stepsons, daughters and
stepdaughters; and the spouses of each. (e) In-kind services shall refer to
administrative personnel services and nonadministrative personnel and other
than personnel services for which the company would ordinarily be required to
pay. (f) Persons of low income
shall mean individuals and families whose annual incomes do not exceed 90
percent of the median annual income for all residents of the region within
which they reside, or of a larger area encompassing such region for which
median annual income can be determined. (g) Region or service area shall mean those
portions of the rural area of the State within which housing preservation and
community renewal activities are to be carried out. (h) Rural area of the State shall mean
cities, towns and villages within the State having a population of less than
20,000. (i) Rural preservation
company or company shall mean a corporation organized under the provisions of
the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law which has been engaged primarily in one or
more housing preservation and community renewal activities. (j) Rural preservation companies program or
RPP shall mean the program of providing housing preservation and community
renewal activities in the rural areas of the State pursuant to this Chapter and
article XVII of the Private Housing Finance Law. (k) Special populations shall refer to the
following: minorities, the physically and/or mentally disabled, senior
citizens, the homeless, single parents and veterans of the Vietnam
conflict. Notes
